description.narrative: Output 35 A system for effective Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) sector co-ordination, knowledge management and evidence-based decision-making is operational and resilient at national level and in 5 most deprived regions by the end of 2016, which contributes to Sanitation, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 10: Enabling environment: Sector policies, strategies, knowledge base, systems and human resource capacity at national level and in 5 most deprived regions are improved for enabling decentralised, scaled-up, sustainable and pro-poor Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) services by 2016

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 35 A system for effective WASH sector co-ordination, knowledge management and evidence-based decision-making is operationaland resilient at national level and in 5 most deprived regions by the end of 2016

description.narrative: UNICEF supported ongoing strengthening of WASH governance, including regional and coordination mechanisms (five regions); national sanitation and water information and reporting systems and critical research on rural sanitation, WASH in Schools and budget monitoring, whilst WASH Equity Study recommendations are shaping government approaches and reporting indicators with an equity focus. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:21/12/2017

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available

actual.value: 2017:Basis Sanitation Information System piloted in two regions

title.narrative: National monitoring systems reporting on equity of access to WASH services available
Sector coordination structures functional at national and in 5 regions

baseline.value: Suboptimal national level coordination structures exist

target.value: 2017:Coordination Structures funcitonal at national and in 5 regions

actual.value: 2017:Coordination mechanisms have been functional in 5 regions. National level government led coordination mechanisms have not been functional in 2017.
